description.p: I remember it so clearly, it was fleeting, but it was there, it came as soon as it arrived. My first thought, the first thing my core ever thought of, a simple phrase: Why am I here?

Constructs created from the parts of meteorites or comets, some of these mindless automatons develop sentience after a single catalyzing thought. This thought ruminates within the starforged as it continues its fulfilling designated function, but slowly grwos into more an d more thoughts, until flowering into sentience and a concept of self. Though this process varies between individual starforged, each ones first thought remains universally the single thing that it dedicates its life to unravelling.

Starforged are a singular bright and white core surrounded by rock and metal. The core acts as the brain, as well as the eyes and mouth of the creature. THe rock and metal that makes up their giant appearance, floats around this core, simulating a humanoid shape. They will rarely form heads however, letting their core rest in the middle of their chest instead.

A Starforgeds life is dedicated to understanding its first thought, normally to answering its question or unravelling the meaning behin that thought. Starforged are innately curious about the world, learning by testing and observing their surroundings. They tend to be empathic towards other humanoids regarding those tinier than them as helples and cute, invoking their innate protective feelings. However upon being betrayed their white hot anger awakes, turning them into deadly machines of death.

Nameless before achieving sentience, a starforged chooses one or is given a name after gaining a sense of self. Names given to a starforged by another creature might be abandoned if the name giver betrays their trust or cherished, if they have a good relationship to the Starforged.

Names chosen by a Starforged itself often relate to its first thought, sometimes creating anagrams of the thought. Thoughts such as "Who am I?" might be rearranged like Whaimo or abbreviated into names such as Ami.
Your starforged characterhas certain traits derived from its cosmic and constructed nature.
Ability Score Increase. Your Constitution score increases by 2, and one other ability score of your choice increases by 1.

AgeAfter achieving senience, starforged mature at the same age as humans, at least emotionally, hence their constructed bodies. They can live until their core runs out of energy, a process that may take anywhere between 700 and 70.000 years.
AlignmentMost Starforged are humble and kind, tending towards good alignments. However once their anger has been awakened there is no limit to the cruelties a Srarforged could commit.

Size modifier = 2d6
Height = 10 feet + 10 inches + your size modifier in inches

ul.li: You don’t need to eat, drink, or breathe.
You don’t need to sleep and don't suffer the effects of exhaustion due to lack of rest, and magic can’t put you to sleep.
You have resistance to cold damage, for you are made to endure the cold of space.

ul.li: Your body is composed of metal, stone and strands of starlight. Your AC equals 13 + your Constitution modifier + your dexterity modifier.. A shield’s benefits apply as normal while you use your natural armor.

description.p: Luminous Core. You know the light cantrip. Constitution is your spellcasting ability for it.

description.p: The Leviakin truly are terrifying people. Not only are they descendants of the monster that bit off a quarter of this continents land, but they're also an unpredictable, warwaging society.

Leviakin resmble the great beast they were borbn from, the legendary Leviathan. The Leviathan was reffered to be unstoppable. A few centuries ago, it faded away. The bonly thing left behind was the new race: the Leviakin. While there is few differences in appearance between the two genders, physically males are usually larger and more aggressive, wheras the females exhibit a darker coloration. The Leviakins bcks are covered in an azure shell-like carapace with a soft, beige scaled underbelly. They sport long necks with cobra like hoods, ending in their flattened head and long snout. Their heads are adorned with horns that vary in sizes from tiny to humongous. Additonally juttingfom the sides of a Leviakins neck are vibrant orange spines, which also protrude in a large amount from its back. With webbed hands and feet, aloong with their muscular paddle-like tails the Leviakin exhibit unmatched aquatic mobility. While amphibious and adapted to both land and water living, the hind legs Leviakin stand with are rather short and stocky, preventing them from incredibly dextrous movement out of the sea. Of course nothing stops them from getting on all fours and speeding after a target. which has indeed been proven to be a reliable strategy.

Being excellent hunters and immensly powerful, the leviakin lie at the top of the food chain in their marshy and aquatic habitat. They often raid villages and plunder towns killing those who stand against them with a cold, calculated rage.
Your leviakin character´has multiple unique traits due to its ancient ancestry
Ability Score Increase. Your Constitution score increases by 2

AgeSimilar to Lizardfolk, Leviakin grow quickly. They walk, hours after hatching, attaining the size of a 10 year old human child by the age of 5. They reach adukthood with 20, getting to be up to 500 Years old.

AlignmentLeviakin only see the world as a place of predator and prey, where life and death are natural processes. They wish only to sate their hunger and survive, however they deem fit. This leads toward the chaotic spectrum of alignments and possibly even towards evil.
Size Your size is Large. Leviakin grow up to be between 10 and 14 feet tall and weigh between 450 and 600 pounds.

Speed Your base walking speed is 25 feet. You have a swimming speed of 40 feet and a climbing speed of 15 feet. You can climb on vertical surfaces and upside down without any hindrance thanks to your giants claws.

After you use your breath weapon, you can’t use it again until you complete a short or long rest.

description.p: "Starborn might not fit in campaigns that start at a level below 5th or you might want to rule that your player can only user their humanoid form until they reach 5th level"

Starborn are a people of glowing balls of pure energy and light, effectively making them cousins to both Stars and Ben'nir. Starborn look like what you'd imagine a tiny star too look like, that you'd actually be capable too look at without burning your eyes out. They range in size from barely 3 to almost 4 feet, hovering around always on the hunt for another adventure. If seen at night they might be confused with will-o'-the-wisps. However you may rest assured they in no way share their harmful intentions.

Starborn form when two Elder Stars choose to collide. In effect they are the direct decendants of the elder stars. They are a species born from love so great that it sacrifices itself to form new life. Hence Starborn are extremely rare, even in the fra realms there are only a few thousand of them, and never more than a few hundred of them reside in the material plane. Instead of mourning the loss of their dead parents however one might find, that Starorn a re a happy people that cherish life and everything they can experience, effectively making them into adventure crazed hedonists. However they tend to have no problem with getting their hands dirty if they find the result to be pleasurable enough to compensate for their labour.

Starborn don't have names at the start of their live, rather they search for them their whole lives. Some of them might find a person they hold dear that gives them a name and they will adopt it as their true name, others might search for their name until the end of their life. However they might find their names, it is something deeply personal that might shape the personality of a Starborn forver.
Starborn gain some unique traits from their celestial Parents.

Ability Score Increase.Your Wisdom score increases by 3.
Age.You inherited the immortal nature of your ancestors.
Alignment.Starborn are even less "of this world" than their cousins the Ben'nir and thus have no inherent inclination towards any single alignment. Their behavior can rather be a whole storm of different felings, most of them unknown to humanoids, that might or might not dictate a Starborns behavior.
Size.You are as big as the legendary "Basque ete Bawl." Roughly 3 feet in diameter. Your size is Small.
Speed.Unlike humanoids you don't possess any feet that might keep you walking, instead you have been blessed with the ability to hover around at a speed of 50 feet.
Eye of the Beholder.You basically are an ominidirectional, allseeing eye. Granting you truesight within your normal line of vision.
Immortality. Due to your immortal nature you are immune to being blinded, charmed or frightened, and magic can’t put you to sleep. You do not need to eat, drink, breathe, or sleep. However you still benefit from short and long rests.
Celestial Body.Upon turning into your Starborn form, any items you posses are either absorbed by you and may be produced from your body as a bonus action or orbit your body like the rings of Saturn.
Languages.You can speak, read, and write Common and Celestial.
Subrace.There are two types of Starborn, the Golgri and Lytra.

You are immune to being blinded, charmed, frightened and being put to sleep. You do not need to eat, drink, breathe, or sleep. You never make Endurance checks to resist the effect of starvation, thirst, exhaustion, or suffocation. However you still benefit from short and long rests.

description.p: "Don't judge a book by it's cover."

Shapeshifter in their true form appear as silver coloured, vaguely humanoid shapes, that strongly resemble humans, except for their glowing eyes. Rarely as never seen in their true form, shapeshifters like to keep it that way, shying away from wizards or other beings known to use truesight and will only reveal themselves if they deem ultimately necessary to protect either themselves or their friends. However not much is known about the nature of the Shapeshifters, as they adapt to the cultures they interact with and even remodelling their moral compass after those.

Shapeshifters are born when the blood of a Ben'nir is mixed with the tears of a Starborn. After blood and tears are mixed, the fluid is poured on the ground during a full moon and after exactly one year and a day, a small silvery plant has grown, bearing a single fruit. Upon midnight the fruit opens and exposes its silvery glowing core to the sky. If it rains when the fruit opens, a Shapeshifter is born, if it doesn't the fruit closes again and waits another century. If the fruit is however reaped on a full moon and a humanoid consumes it, the humanoid is transformed into a Shapeshifter. Hence the Ben'nir and Starborn being an already rare people, the Shifter folk are extremely rare, ocurring only once or twice in a population of millions.

Shapeshifters are naturally born predators that feed on both humanoids and beasts during their adolescence, which prolongs until they reach an age of about 40 years. Equiped with everything a predator would need to hunt down humanoids, Shapeshifters prefer to literally hunt their prey, making them a reason for the fear people developed for vampires. Able to change their bodies in literally any way Shpaeshifters are impossible to pin or hunt down in response to their actions, let alone to even identifiy them, for they lack any DNA or blood, which would enable a policeforce to actually track them down. Hence anything short of magical means to find and catch a shapeshifter in all but the most strange societies, are doomed to fail.

Shapeshifters often change their names as they change their form, or they might choose one name that is deemed androgynous and sometimes even bestial by the comumunities they most often interact with.

You have uniqe traits granted to you by your mysterious heritage.

Age.Shapeshifter are just as Immortal as their cousins. Until they reach 40 years they are adulescent and require food in form of humanoids or beasts, after which they discard feeding alltogether.
Alignment.Shapeshifter tend towards chaotic alignments.
Size.You might change your physical appearance at a whim, however you count as medium for the determination of carrying weight and such.
Speed.Due to your ability of changing your shape at will, you are capable to create any kind of limbs you need.Your base speed is 40 feet.
Illumination.Your eyes are the only obvious phenotypical feature you share with your Ben'nir and Starborn cousins. They glow in a faint light, granting you truesight out to 120 feet, and you cannot be blinded.
Immortality.Like your cousins you inherited your immortal nature from youir ancestors. You do not need to eat, drink, breathe, or sleep. However you still benefit from short and long rests.
Shapeshifting.
You can change your whole body with a mere thought. You determine the specifics of the changes, including your coloration, hair length, and sex, voice how many limbs you have and how they are arranged etc. You can also adjust your height and weight, but you may only change it so much that you are on size category bigger or smaller than medium. You can make yourself appear as a member of another race, though none of your game statistics change except for those mentioned below. Additionally You can’t duplicate the appearance of a creature you’ve never seen. Your clothing and equipment aren’t changed by this trait, however you may make your body look like you are wearing clothing. You stay in the new form until you choose to revert to your true form or until you die.
Natural Weapons You grow claws, fangs, spines, horns, or a different natural weapon of your choice. Your unarmed strikes deal 1d6 +your dexterity modifier bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage, as appropriate to the natural weapon you chose, and you are proficient with your unarmed strikes. Finally, the natural weapon counts as magical.
Movement You can grow wings, webbing between your fingers and a mermaids tail, claws that help you burrow your way through the earth, or tiny spider-like fybrills on your extremities, that grant you an upside-down climbing speed, a flying speed, a burrowing speed or a swiming speed of 40 feet.
Vocal Adaption You adapt your speech for the different mediums you move through. You can adapt your voice and hearing to: Aquatic environments, using higher frequencies like whales. The void, using telekinesis out to 120 feet instead of normal speech. You adapt your vocal muscles to perfectly reproduce heard sounds, yes even chainsaws. You automatically adapt your vocalisation to perfectly intonate a language you speak, always sounding like a native speaker, even if you just reiterate phrases of a language you barely know.
Natural Armor. You shape your body in such a way that your dermis is tougher or that ýou have an exosekleton instead of a dermis that protects you. You gain a +2 bonus to your Armor Class..
Languages.You can speak, read, and write Common and Celestial.
